greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number having n orderless representations as p^2 + q^2 + r^2, where p, q, and r are primes.
link: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: nn = 10^6; ps = Prime[Range[PrimePi[Sqrt[nn]]]]; t = Flatten[Table[ps[[i]]^2 + ps[[j]]^2 + ps[[k]]^2, {i, Length[ps]}, {j, i, Length[ps]}, {k, j, Length[ps]}]]; t = Select[t, # <= nn &]; t2 = Sort[Tally[t]]; u = Union[Transpose[t2][[2]]]; d = Complement[Range[u[[-1]]], u]; If[d == {}, nLim = u[[-1]], nLim = d[[1]]-1]; t3 = Table[Select[t2, #[[2]] == n &, 1][[1]], {n, nLim}]; Transpose[t3][[1]]
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Jul 29 2012
